questions.text: How far from Cliff's house does Norm drop him off?
questions.explanation:
1 mile.

	Usually it's six blocks away, according to Cliff. Norm drops him off so far from his house because Norm gets sick of listening to Cliff talk.

questions.text: What did Sam say when Rebecca asked him what they would tell their child about the night he was conceived?
questions.correct: How about, mind your own business?
options: We just did it fast and got it done.
questions.explanation:
How about, mind your own business?.

	Rebecca wanted their baby making to be special. Sam just wanted to do it and get it done.

questions.text: When Woody asked the bowling team to move to the smoking section, what did the bowler do?
questions.explanation:
Blew smoke in Woody's face.

	The bowling team was rather rude. When Cliff asked Woody what they said, Woody blew the smoke into Cliff's face.

questions.text: Who made Sam nervous about making a baby?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Rebecca said she was nervous because they were making the biggest decision of their lives. He tried to talk her out of feeling nervous and instead made himself more nervous.

questions.text: Why did Sam tell Rebecca he was leaving?
questions.correct: To get a Johnny Mathis CD
options: To grab a bite to eat
questions.explanation:
To get a Johnny Mathis CD.

	When Rebecca tried to stop him he said, "If we're gonna make a baby, I'm gonna need my Johnny!" In reality, he went to Cheers to talk to Frasier about the fact that he couldn't perform because he was so nervous.

questions.text: When Frasier asked Sam what was wrong, what did Sam keep saying?
questions.explanation:
I can't.

	Frasier thought Sam was saying he couldn't tell Frasier what was wrong. Sam meant he couldn't have sex.

questions.text: What advice did Frasier give Sam?
questions.correct: Not to think about making a baby
options: To concentrate hard on making a baby
questions.explanation:
Not to think about making a baby.

	Meanwhile, Rebecca talked to Lilith and she told Rebecca to keep reminding Sam he's making a baby. This didn't work for Sam at all and he finally told Rebecca the problem.

questions.text: Where did Woody move the smokers to?
questions.explanation:
The poolroom.

	Carla told him there was "no installation and the windows were all painted shut." When Woody turned on the fan it blew Carla in the air.

yes.

	When Sam asked Norm where Woody was, he told him Woody was "otherwise engaged". Then, you saw Carla attacking Woody.

questions.text: When Sam opened the door at the end, what was the neighbor listening to?
questions.explanation:
Johnny Mathis.

	Sam and Rebecca kissed goodnight. Then they kissed longer, having decided to make a baby after all (this was implied not stated).
